verses.verse: All the tax collectors and the sinful people were near Him to be listening to Him.
And the Separatists and the Old Testament transcribers were grumbling among themselves, saying, "This Person accepts sinful people in and eats together with them."
He told this illustration to them, saying,

"What person from among you who has a hundred sheep, and when he loses one from them, does not leave the ninety-nine down in the backcountry and travel based on the one that has been lost until he finds it?
And when he finds it, he places it on his own shoulders being happy.
And when he comes into the house, he calls the friends and the neighbors together, saying to them, 'Be happy together with me because I found my sheep, the one that has been lost.'
I tell you that this is how there will be happiness in heaven over one sinful person changing his ways than over ninety-nine that do what is right, some that have no need of a change of ways.
Or what woman having ten drachmas (silver coins), if she loses one drachma, does she not light a lamp, sweep the house, and look carefully until a certain time that she will find it?
And after finding it, she calls the friends and the neighbors together, saying, 'Be happy together with me because I found the drachma that I lost.'
This is how, I tell you, happiness happens in the sight of the angels of God over one sinful person changing his ways."
He said, "A certain person had two sons.
And the younger of them said to his father, 'Father, give me the part of the assets tossing over to me.' And he divvied out the livelihood to them.
And after not many days, when the younger son gathered absolutely everything, he left the area to go to a distant rural area. And there he squandered his assets, living recklessly.
After he spent everything, a strong famine happened throughout that rural area, and he began to be lacking.
And after he traveled, he was stuck like glue to one of the citizens of that rural area. And he sent him into his fields to be feeding hogs.
And he was desiring to fill his belly from the carob tree pods that the hogs were eating. And no one was giving to him.
When he came to himself, he said, 'How many paid workers of my father have loaves of bread left over, but I am being ruined by a famine.
After getting up, I will travel to my father and state to him, "Father, I sinned to heaven and in your sight.
I am no longer even deserving to be called your son. Make me as one of your paid workers."'

And after getting up, he went to his own father. But as he had himself still a long way away, his father saw him and had sympathy. And after running to him, he fell on his neck and was very friendly to him.
The son said to him, 'Father, I sinned to heaven and in your sight. I no longer am even deserving to be called your son.'
But the father said to his slaves, 'Bring out the long robe, the most important one, and put it on him. And give him a ring for his hand and sandals for his feet.
And after bringing the calf, the grain-fed one, kill it, and after eating, we will celebrate
because this one, my son, was dead, and he came to life again; and he had been lost and was found.' And they began to celebrate.
His son, the older one, was in a field. And going home, as he was near the house, he heard musical harmony and circle dancing.
And after calling for one of the servant boys, he was inquiring what these things might be.
The boy said to him, 'Your brother has arrived, and your father killed the calf, the grain-fed one, because he received him back healthy.'
He was enraged and did not want to go in. So after his father came out, he was encouraging him.

When the son responded, he said to his father, 'Look, for so many years, I am a slave to you, and I never even once passed by your demand. And you never even once gave me a goat so that I might celebrate with my friends.
When your son, this one who ate up your livelihood with prostitutes, came, you killed the calf for him, the grain-fed calf.'
But the father said to him, 'Child, you are always with me, and all my things are yours.
It was necessary to celebrate and to be happy because your brother, this one, was dead and came to life again, and had been lost and was found.'"
